publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3414 Des McNulty: Trade Justice—That the Parliament recognises that global trade rules are weighted against poor countries, their people and the environment; believes that governments in poor countries should have the flexibility to choose those policies that will help them to end poverty and protect the environment; notes the Trade Justice Movement’s mass lobby of the UK Parliament on 2 November 2005, and recognises that more than 600,000 people across the United Kingdom have already voted for trade justice, an end to export dumping and regulations that stop big business from profiting at the expense of people and the environment.
S2M-3414 Trade Justice (lodged on 13 October 2005) Mike Pringle*, Patrick Harvie*, Irene Oldfather*, Marlyn Glen*
S2M-3414 Trade Justice (lodged on 13 October 2005) Christine Grahame*
S2M-3414 Trade Justice (lodged on 13 October 2005) Donald Gorrie*
S2M-3414 Trade Justice (lodged on 13 October 2005) Susan Deacon*, Michael McMahon*, Dennis Canavan*

S2M-3414 Trade Justice (lodged on 13 October 2005) Brian Adam*, Robin Harper*, Jackie Baillie*, Helen Eadie*, Trish Godman*, Tommy Sheridan*, Bill Butler*, Fiona Hyslop*, Scott Barrie*, Nora Radcliffe*, Chris Ballance*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Shiona Baird*, Bristow Muldoon*, Karen Gillon*, Richard Lochhead*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Eleanor Scott*, Cathie Craigie*
S2M-3414 Trade Justice (lodged on 13 October 2005) Elaine Smith*
S2M-3414 Trade Justice (lodged on 13 October 2005) Iain Smith*
S2M-3414 Trade Justice (lodged on 13 October 2005) Mr Andrew Arbuckle* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
S2M-3414 Trade Justice (lodged on 13 October 2005) Dr Elaine Murray* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
